subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Giordano Bruno: The Martyr Science Claims
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Giordano Bruno: The Martyr Science Claims.

hook.text: Burned alive in 1600 for saying the universe is infinite. Bruno is called science's first martyr. But is that true?

buildup.text: Giordano Bruno was a Dominican friar who proposed infinite worlds. The Church executed him for heresy in Rome.

discovery.text: His heresies included denying the Trinity and the divinity of Christ. Cosmology was a minor charge, not the main one.

twist.text: Bruno was a mystic and occultist, not a scientist. He had no data or method. His ideas were intuitions, not discoveries.

climax.text: Bruno's execution was wrong. But calling him a science martyr distorts history. The truth is more nuanced than the myth.

punchline.text: Bruno was burned for heresy, not science. The truth is more complex.

quiz.question: Why was Giordano Bruno executed?
options: Primarily for theological heresies including denying the Trinity
